title: Sartre and Camus pt. 5 - Consciousness is Freedom
summary: Today we talk about Sartre's view of consciousness and the notion of radical freedom.

title: Sartre and Camus pt. 4 - The Quest For Certainty
summary: Today we tell a story from the history of philosophy in an attempt to prepare us for understanding the Phenomenology of Sartre.

title: Heidegger pt. 3 - Authenticity
summary: Today we talk about Martin Heidegger and his concept of Authenticity.

title: Heidegger pt. 2 - Science and Technology
summary: Today we discuss Martin Heidegger and his views on Modern Technology.

title: Heidegger pt. 1 - Phenomenology and Dasein
summary: Today we begin our discussion of the philosophy of Martin Heidegger by looking at his roots in Phenomenology and his revolutionary concept of Dasein.

title: Schopenhauer pt. 2 - Ethics
summary: Today we talk about the ethics of Arthur Schopenhauer.

title: Schopenhauer pt. 1 - Metaphysics and Love
summary: Today we begin our discussion on Arthur Schopenhauer.

title: Wittgenstein ep. 1
summary: Today we talk about Ludwig Wittgenstein.

title: Is Ayn Rand A Philosopher?
summary: Today we talk about Ayn Rand.

title: Are you living in a simulation?
summary: Today we discuss the famous paper by Nick Bostrom about the probability that we are living in a simulation.

title: A Look at Suffering
summary: Today we look at the concept of suffering from multiple different angles including the philosopher Fyodor Dostoyevsky and the movement in Transhumanism known as The Hedonistic Imperative.

title: Nietzsche pt. 4 - Love
summary: Today we look at the concept of love from several different angles in an attempt to better understand our own thoughts on love.

title: Nietzsche pt. 3 - Thus Spoke Zarathustra
summary: Today we talk about Nietzsche's famous work Thus Spoke Zarathustra.

title: Nietzsche pt. 2 - The Will to Power
summary: Today we talk about Nietzsche, the concept of the Will to Power and the dangers of predatory buffalos.

title: Nietzsche pt. 1 - God is dead and so is Captain Morgan
summary: Today we begin our discussion on the work of Friedrich Nietzsche.

title: Simone De Beauvoir - The Second Sex
summary: Today we discuss the revolutionary work of Simone De Beauvoir entitled: The Second Sex

title: Sartre and Camus pt. 3 - The Great Debate
summary: Today we talk about the great post WW2 debate between Sartre and Camus.

title: Sartre and Camus pt. 2
summary: Today we talk about the philosopher Albert Camus.

title: Sartre and Camus pt. 1 - Freedom
summary: Today's episode is the first installment of a series on the great Cold War era thinkers Sartre and Camus. Today we lay the foundations for the line of thinking known as existentialism and focus on Sartre's view of freedom.

title: Peter Singer on Effective Altruism
summary: Today we talk about the great Peter Singer, his views on the unique moral obligations that we face as members of modern society and how we might fulfill the obligations in the most effective manner.

title: William James on Truth
summary: Today we take a look at William James and his work on the concept of Truth.

title: Henry David Thoreau
summary: Today we take a look at Henry David Thoreau's views on the individual, society and civil disobedience.

title: Austrians and Marx
summary: Today we talk about various classic critiques of Marx's economics made by the Austrian School of Economics. I really wanted to call this episode "X Marx the Spot", but it didn't make enough sense and wasn't very search friendly.

title: Capitalism vs. Communism
summary: Today we talk about Karl Marx and his famous critiques of Capitalism.

title: Feuerbach on Religion
summary: On this episode we talk about Ludwig Feuerbach and his (occasionally) controversial views on the origins of religion.

title: Kierkegaard on Anxiety
summary: On this episode of the podcast we talk about Kierkegaard's views on the value of anxiety and the plight of one in its grips.

title: Marx and Kierkegaard on Religion pt. 2
summary: Today we talk about Soren Kierkegaard and his views on the function and value of religion.

title: Marx and Kierkegaard on Religion pt. 1
summary: Today we discuss Marx, his views on religion as a means of oppression, and his connection to Hegel's Dialectic.

title: Hegel's God
summary: Today we talk about Hegel and a unique possibility of what God could be.

title: How To Win An Argument Pt. 2
summary: Today we answer listener questions clarifying How To Win An Argument Pt. 1 and discuss several other common logical fallacies, how to spot them and how to deal with them.

title: Hegel Returns
summary: Today we talk about an overview of Hegel and what is truly important about his work.

title: How To Win An Argument Pt. 1
summary: Today we take a look at several common logical fallacies and how to spot them in the throes of a passionate argument. You will be a better person having listened to this episode.

title: Insecurity
summary: On this episode of the podcast we talk about insecurity and why we think and act the way we do.

title: Is Killing Animals For Food Morally Justifiable?
summary: Today we talk about whether killing animals for food is morally justifiable.

title: Off Moodiness
summary: On this episode we talk about the most profound thing you will ever hear in your life: how to quell negative emotions.

title: An Appeal To Reason
summary: Stephen West rambles relentlessly about stuff no one cares about.

title: On Moodiness
summary: On this episode we talk about one angle of the complex subject known to us all as: moodiness.

title: What Hegel Was Saying!
summary: We continue our unfortunately abridged discussion on Hegel from last episode.

title: Hegel pt. 1 - Introduction
summary: Introduction of the philosophy of Hegel
